page.title: 04THE CHURCHES.
page.content: The church at{Fittleton,}built from flint and stone, dates from the early 14th century. It is dedicated to{All {Saints.}The church and churchyard is close to the River Avon. There are six bells in the tower, which has a spire on the top. The bells are rung every Sunday and on special occasions. The oldest bell is dated 1603. One of the most treasured possesions is a silver chalice dated 1610. The church at{Netheravon,}built from flint, stone and rubble, has areas dating from the 11th century which is shown by the herring-bone flint laying as well as Anglo-Saxon work and decoration. It is dedicated to {All {Saints. }The two manual organ was built in 1902. There are six bells,the oldest dated 1585,they continue to be rung every Sunday and other occasions. The church is set in fields with trees
